Spark uses Bluetooth to connect with training devices and other users for multiplayer sessions. This enables synchronized workouts and device connectivity for enhanced training experiences.
Spark uses Bluetooth to connect with training devices and other users for multiplayer sessions. This enables synchronized workouts and device connectivity for enhanced training experiences.
Spark uses Bluetooth to connect with training devices and other users for multiplayer sessions. This enables synchronized workouts and device connectivity for enhanced training experiences.
Spark may use camera access for enhanced training features, form analysis, and multiplayer session management.
Spark can read your health data to provide personalized training recommendations and track your fitness progress.
Spark can save your workout data to the Health app to keep a comprehensive record of your training sessions.
Spark uses local network access to connect with nearby training devices and users for multiplayer sessions. This enables peer-to-peer connections for synchronized training experiences.

Spark needs location access to discover nearby training devices and users for multiplayer sessions. Your precise location is never stored, shared, or transmitted - it's only used locally for Bluetooth device discovery as required by iOS.

Spark needs location access to discover nearby training devices and users for multiplayer sessions. Your precise location is never stored, shared, or transmitted - it's only used locally for Bluetooth device discovery as required by iOS.

Spark needs location access to discover nearby training devices and users for multiplayer sessions. Your precise location is never stored, shared, or transmitted - it's only used locally for Bluetooth device discovery as required by iOS.
Spark may use microphone access for voice commands, audio feedback, and enhanced multiplayer communication features during training sessions.
Spark uses motion data to track your training performance, analyze movement patterns, and provide personalized workout feedback.
Spark uses nearby interaction to enhance multiplayer training sessions by providing better device discovery and connection stability for synchronized workouts.
